page.title: 09HOUSING IN/AROUND CHAGFORD
page.content: While most of the houses in and around Chagford are{privately owned,}there are some{Council Houses}in Chagford itself. There are examples of mag_ nificent houses standing in their own grounds, some dating back to the 13th and 14th Centuries. One style part_ icular to this area is the{Devon long_ {house,}which is basically a house with a central cross_passage. On one side of this passage lived the people, while on the other lived the animals. The majority of old houses have roofs of{thatch}and walls partly of{Cob,}a mixture of straw, dung and water, and mostly of granite, found in abundance. Houses have been built within the last two years in Chagford itself, while the bungalows in the{Lamb Park}estate have been built for some 10 years. Moorlands caters for old people as does the{Greenacres Nursing Home.
